icon.contents: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' xmlns:xlink='http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink' width='18' height='18' viewBox='0 0 18 18'%3E%3Cimage xlink:href='data:image/png;base64,' x='0' y='0' height='100%25' width='100%25'/%3E%3C/svg%3E

properties.label: Operation
properties.description: Operation to be done

properties.label: host
properties.description: Hostname/computer name or IP address of mysql server host. e.g. localhost

properties.label: port
properties.description: Port for MySQL server. e.g. 3306

properties.label: username
properties.description: Username with DB access

properties.label: password
properties.description: Password for username e.g. secrets.TOKEN, Secrets can be used to reference encrypted authentication credentials in Connectors. See the Secrets documentation for more details.

properties.label: databaseName
properties.description: Name of the database containing the table

properties.label: tableName
properties.description: Name of the table which needs to be altered

properties.label: Method Type
properties.description: Operation to be done

properties.label: constraintDetails
properties.description: Details of constraints in the following format. e.g. [{'Name':'unique','Symbol':'constraint_symbol', 'Definition':'columnName' }]

properties.label: newTableName
properties.description: New name of the table

properties.label: newColumnDetail
properties.description: Map of (oldColName, newColName) e.g. {'oldColName':'OldColumnName', 'newColName':'NewColumnName'}

properties.label: columnsDetails
properties.description: List of Columns - Map of (colName, dataType, constraint) to add e.g. [{'colName':'ColumnName', 'dataType':'DataType(SIZE)', 'constraint': 'UNIQUE'}, ...]

properties.label: modifyColumnsDetails
properties.description: List of columns details to modify e.g. [{'colName':'city', 'dataType': 'varchar(20)', 'constraint': 'NOT NULL'}, ...]

properties.label: dropEntityDetails
properties.description: Details of entity to be dropped in the following format. e.g. [{'entityToDrop':'FOREIGN KEY', 'name':'fk_address'}, ...]

properties.label: databaseName
properties.description: New database name

properties.label: databaseName
properties.description: Name of the database containing the table

properties.label: tableName
properties.description: New table name

properties.label: columnsList
properties.description: List of the columns in format: [{'colName':'Age', 'dataType': 'varchar(255)', 'constraints': ['UNIQUE']}]. Following constraints are allowed: "NOT NULL", "PRIMARY KEY", "UNIQUE", "AUTO_INCREMENT"

properties.label: databaseName
properties.description: Name of the database containing the table

properties.label: tableName
properties.description: Table/collection name to delete data from

properties.label: filters
properties.description: Data Type: Map.of(String, Object), Desc: Filter Map can have 3 keys filter, logicalOperator & filterList. Simple filter e.g. {"filter": {"colName": "ColumnName", "operator": "=", "value": ColumnValue}}

properties.label: orderBy
properties.description: Data Type: List.of(Map.of(String, String)), Desc: List of Maps will have 2 keys: sortOn and order. sortOn value will be column name for orderBy and order as ascending/descending. e.g. [{"sortOn":"ColumnName", "order":"ascending"}]

properties.label: limit
properties.description: Maximum number of rows to delete

properties.label: databaseName
properties.description: Name of the database containing the table

properties.label: tableName
properties.description: Name of the table in which data needs to be inserted

properties.label: dataToInsert
properties.description: [{"columnName1": row1Col1Value, "columnName2": row1Col2Value...}, {"columnName1", row2Col1Value, "columnName2", row2Col2Value...}...] Data to insert into the table

properties.label: databaseName
properties.description: Name of the database containing the table

properties.label: tableName
properties.description: Table/collection name to read data from

properties.label: columnNames
properties.description: List of columns/fields to return in result. If empty will return all columns/fields.  e.g. ["columnName1", "columnName2",...]

properties.label: filters
properties.description: Data Type: Map.of(String, Object), Desc: Filter Map can have 3 keys filter, logicalOperator & filterList. Simple filter e.g. {"filter": {"colName": "ColumnName", "operator": "=", "value": ColumnValue}}

properties.label: orderBy
properties.description: Data Type: List.of(Map.of(String, String)), Desc: List of Maps will have 2 keys: sortOn and order. sortOn value will be column name for orderBy and order as ascending/descending. e.g. [{"sortOn":"ColumnName", "order":"ascending"}]

properties.label: limit
properties.description: Data Type: Integer, Desc: Maximum number of rows in output

properties.label: databaseName
properties.description: Name of the database containing the table

properties.label: tableName
properties.description: Table Name in which data needs to be updated

properties.label: updateMap
properties.description: Context with column name and value to update data in table. e.g. {"columnName1":colValue, "columnName2":"colVal"}

properties.label: filters
properties.description: Data Type: Map.of(String, Object), Desc: Filter Map can have 3 keys filter, logicalOperator & filterList. Simple filter e.g. {"filter": {"colName": "ColumnName", "operator": "=", "value": ColumnValue}}. If filter is null or empty, all rows in table will be updated

properties.label: orderBy
properties.description: Data Type: List.of(Map.of(String, String)), Desc: List of Maps will have 2 keys: sortOn and order. sortOn value will be column name for orderBy and order as ascending/descending. e.g. [{"sortOn":"ColumnName", "order":"ascending"}]

properties.label: limit
properties.description: Data Type: Integer, Desc: Maximum number of rows to update

properties.label: Result Variable
properties.description: Name of variable to store the response in

properties.label: Result Expression
properties.description: Expression to map the response into process variables

properties.label: Error Expression
properties.description: Expression to handle errors. Details in the documentation.
